basics.name: Nina Herrmann
basics.label: Scientist
basics.summary: Excited to evluate the reference of technology

publications.name: High-level parallel ant colony optimization with algorithmic skeletons
publications.summary: A parallel implementation of the Ant Colony Optimization Algorithm. For this purpose Muesli was used, a high-level framework based on algorithmic skeletons.

publications.name: Stencil calculations with algorithmic skeletons for heterogeneous computing environments
publications.summary: Evaluate the efficency on automatically distributing stencil operations on multiple nodes, and computational cores (including CPUs and GPUs).

publications.name: Distributed Calculations with Algorithmic Skeletons for Heterogeneous Computing Environments
publications.summary: An evaluation of distributing computations with a high-level library on multiple nodes and cores (including CPUs and GPUs).

publications.name: Optimizing Three-Dimensional Stencil-Operations on Heterogeneous Computing Environments
publications.summary: Evaluate the efficency on automatically distributing three-dimensional stencil operations on multiple nodes, and computational cores (including CPUs and GPUs).

projects.name: TinyAIoT
projects.summary: The aim of the TinyAIoT project is to reduce these resource requirements by developing efficient and particularly small AI models that can be used on microcontrollers.
